levels.title: Add DOCTYPE
levels.summary: Add a DOCTYPE to an HTML file
levels.content: HTML files should have a `DOCTYPE`. You can add one at the top of the `index.html` file like this: `<!DOCTYPE html>`.

hints: Add `<!DOCTYPE html>` at the top of `index.html` and save the file

levels.title: Add English ISO Language Code and a header tag
levels.summary: Add English ISO Language Code to an HTML file as well as a header tag with meta tags and a title tag.
levels.content:
HTML files should have a `lang` attribute. You can add one under the `DOCTYPE` like this:
`<html lang="en">`.

HTML files have `<head></head>` elements that are containers for metadata. Metadata will usually define
the document title, character set, styles, scripts, and other meta information.

Add a header element and include metadata and a title like this:

```html
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Document</title>
</head>
```

hints: For 3.1: Add `<html lang="en">` under the `DOCTYPE` you just created in `index.html` and save the file
For 3.2:  Add `<head></head>` tag and place 2 `<meta>` tags and a `<title>Document</title>` inside the header tag

steps.content: Add a header tag with 2 meta tags and a title that says "Document"
